newsitem.title: USA: California quake insurance agency sees brisk sales.
newsitem.headline: California quake insurance agency sees brisk sales.

text.p: The California Earthquake Authority issued nearly 30,000 quake insurance policies in its first two months of operation and should top one million in another 12 months, its top executive said Friday.
Interim Chief Executive Greg Butler said the authority has grown about as quickly as expected and has already built a solid financial base with $118 million in cash on hand.
With an estimated 29,800 policies currently to its name, the newly created state authority is the 15th largest earthquake insurer in California, Butler said in an interview.
Thus far, its policies have been sold through only a few companies, including Allstate Corp and Farmers Insurance Group Inc. This should soon change.

In March and April, Butler said several other insurance companies are expected to begin selling California Earthquake Authority (CEA) policies. The addition of these companies should significantly boost its growth rate, he said.

"As we enter the second quarter of the year, we'll start growing much more quickly," Butler said. Within 12 months, the CEA should have over one million policies issued, becoming one of the largest earthquake insurers in the state, he said.
